intro: Phalangium adenanthera, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic if ingested. Phalangium adenanthera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
